module_restrictions.Restricted Courses: Due to high demand from degree-seeking students at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, some courses are not available to incoming exchange students.
Closed Programs: College of Business (ACCY, BADM, and FIN courses)
School of Labor and Employment Relations
Department of Recreation, Sport, and Tourism (online graduate courses only)
Any internships, co-op programs, or teaching practicums in local schools.
Limited Programs: Department of Mechanical Science and Engineering
Architecture (College of Fine & Applied Arts)—limited access to studio classes
Electrical and Computer Engineering (College of Engineering)
Kinesiology (College of Applied Health Sciences)—some limitations
Landscape Architecture (College of Fine & Applied Arts)—enrollment in studio classes must be pre-arranged

visa_info: You will need to show a passport, entry visa, and original DS-2019 (no copies) at the United States Port of Entry.
Students will be required to enroll in the compulsory health insurance policy or scheme at their SEP host university.
accommodations_info: UIUC does not reserve housing for students. You are responsible for arranging your own housing. There are many housing options available to exchange students.
university_description: The University of Illinois Urbana Champaign is a comprehensive university in Illinois, USA.
location_cost_of_living: For more information on cost of living, please refer to the following link: http://www.studyabroad.illinois.edu/incoming-students/incoming-student-finances/
location_description: Champaign is a city in central Illinois, USA, and home to the University of Illinois Urbana Champaign.
location_crime: For more information about safety and crime rates in Champaign, please refer to the following link: http://police.illinois.edu/about/contact-us/
